Abhiraj Smit

Stony Brook, New York

I am experienced in leveraging frameworks and technologies. I have 2+ years of work experience in Goldman Sachs and Amazon as a Software Developer. I am also interested in competitive coding and have constantly set competitive coding problems at Hackeearth and GeeksforGeeks. I am currently a Grad student at Stony Brook University with specialization in Computer Science.

Experience

Intern – Software Developer at AWS EC2 Security

Amazon Web Services, Seattle
  • Designed an end to end architecture to enhance customer security by removing the data stored in S3 buckets which are outdated.
  • Provided an API and CLI option to client to set the number of days they want data to be stored.
June 2020 - August 2020

Software Engineer at Document Lake, Pricing Technology

Goldman Sachs, Bengaluru
  • Conceived and implemented the plan to migrate an older system to the Document lake. The new migrated system can process up to 10 million files and can process 1TB of data per day, hence improving throughput of over 80% per day compared to the older system.
  • Brainstormed and devised a scalable multithreaded solution using Kafka to migrate files to Cloud using Amazon S3.
  • Improvised the migration plan by introducing Mongo DB as staging table to store Kafka offset and added ability to replay retained messages from Topic. Provided this capability as a secure REST endpoint which helped in rerunning the record from SwaggerUI.
June 2017 - April 2019

Summer Employee at DataFactory

Goldman Sachs, Bengaluru
  • Developed the Tasks UI to gather input from Operations in AngularJS2 replacing the previous employed method of emails.
  • Streamlined the process by generating tasks at runtime and delegating the tasks to maintain timely response.
May 2016 – Jun 2016

Software Developer at GeeksforGeeks and Algorithmic Problem Setter at Practice@GeeksforGeeks

GeeksForGeeks, Noida

• Added new features in practice.geeksforgeeks and created new algorithmic problems for their contests. Taught algorithms and data structures in Geeks classes (offline classes) and managed the functioning of their live online courses which had over 3500+ students.

December 2015 – January 2015, April 2019 – July 2019

    Interests
